dbt-cli-global-configs.name: dbt CLI Global Configs
dbt-cli-global-configs.description:
Global configs control things like the visual output
of logs, the manner in which dbt parses your project,
and what to do when dbt finds a version mismatch
or a failing model. Docs can be found [here](
https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/global-configs).
dbt-cli-global-configs.code_example:
Load stored GlobalConfigs:
```python
from prefect_dbt.cli.configs import GlobalConfigs

dbt_cli_global_configs = GlobalConfigs.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: GlobalConfigs
fields.description:
Global configs control things like the visual output
of logs, the manner in which dbt parses your project,
and what to do when dbt finds a version mismatch
or a failing model. Docs can be found [here](
https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/global-configs).

extras.title: Extras
extras.description: Extra target configs' keywords, not yet exposed in prefect-dbt, but available in dbt.

send_anonymous_usage_stats.title: Send Anonymous Usage Stats
send_anonymous_usage_stats.description: Whether usage stats are sent to dbt.

use_colors.title: Use Colors
use_colors.description: Colorize the output it prints in your terminal.

partial_parse.title: Partial Parse
partial_parse.description: When partial parsing is enabled, dbt will use an stored internal manifest to determine which files have been changed (if any) since it last parsed the project.

printer_width.title: Printer Width
printer_width.description: Length of characters before starting a new line.

write_json.title: Write Json
write_json.description: Determines whether dbt writes JSON artifacts to the target/ directory.

warn_error.title: Warn Error
warn_error.description: Whether to convert dbt warnings into errors.

log_format.title: Log Format
log_format.description: The LOG_FORMAT config specifies how dbt's logs should be formatted. If the value of this config is json, dbt will output fully structured logs in JSON format.

debug.title: Debug
debug.description: Whether to redirect dbt's debug logs to standard out.

version_check.title: Version Check
version_check.description: Whether to raise an error if a project's version is used with an incompatible dbt version.

fail_fast.title: Fail Fast
fail_fast.description: Make dbt exit immediately if a single resource fails to build.

use_experimental_parser.title: Use Experimental Parser
use_experimental_parser.description: Opt into the latest experimental version of the static parser.

dbt-cli-profile.name: dbt CLI Profile
dbt-cli-profile.description: Profile for use across dbt CLI tasks and flows.
dbt-cli-profile.code_example:
Load stored dbt CLI profile:
```python
from prefect_dbt.cli import DbtCliProfile
dbt_cli_profile = DbtCliProfile.load("BLOCK_NAME").get_profile()
```

Get a dbt Snowflake profile from DbtCliProfile by using SnowflakeTargetConfigs:
```python
from prefect_dbt.cli import DbtCliProfile
from prefect_dbt.cli.configs import SnowflakeTargetConfigs
from prefect_snowflake.credentials import SnowflakeCredentials
from prefect_snowflake.database import SnowflakeConnector

credentials = SnowflakeCredentials(
    user="user",
    password="password",
    account="account.region.aws",
    role="role",
)
connector = SnowflakeConnector(
    schema="public",
    database="database",
    warehouse="warehouse",
    credentials=credentials,
)
target_configs = SnowflakeTargetConfigs(
    connector=connector
)
dbt_cli_profile = DbtCliProfile(
    name="jaffle_shop",
    target="dev",
    target_configs=target_configs,
)
profile = dbt_cli_profile.get_profile()
```

Get a dbt Redshift profile from DbtCliProfile by using generic TargetConfigs:
```python
from prefect_dbt.cli import DbtCliProfile
from prefect_dbt.cli.configs import GlobalConfigs, TargetConfigs

target_configs_extras = dict(
    host="hostname.region.redshift.amazonaws.com",
    user="username",
    password="password1",
    port=5439,
    dbname="analytics",
)
target_configs = TargetConfigs(
    type="redshift",
    schema="schema",
    threads=4,
    extras=target_configs_extras
)
dbt_cli_profile = DbtCliProfile(
    name="jaffle_shop",
    target="dev",
    target_configs=target_configs,
)
profile = dbt_cli_profile.get_profile()
```

fields.title: DbtCliProfile
fields.description: Profile for use across dbt CLI tasks and flows.

name.title: Name
name.description: Profile name used for populating profiles.yml.

target.title: Target
target.description: The default target your dbt project will use.

target_configs.title: Target Configs
target_configs.description: Target configs contain credentials and settings, specific to the warehouse you're connecting to.

global_configs.title: Global Configs
global_configs.description: Global configs control things like the visual output of logs, the manner in which dbt parses your project, and what to do when dbt finds a version mismatch or a failing model.

TargetConfigs.title: TargetConfigs
TargetConfigs.description:
Target configs contain credentials and
settings, specific to the warehouse you're connecting to.
To find valid keys, head to the [Available adapters](
https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/available-adapters) page and
click the desired adapter's "Profile Setup" hyperlink.

extras.title: Extras
extras.description: Extra target configs' keywords, not yet exposed in prefect-dbt, but available in dbt.

type.title: Type
type.description: The name of the database warehouse.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: The schema that dbt will build objects into; in BigQuery, a schema is actually a dataset.

threads.title: Threads
threads.description: The number of threads representing the max number of paths through the graph dbt may work on at once.

dbt-cloud-credentials.name: dbt Cloud Credentials
dbt-cloud-credentials.description: Credentials block for credential use across dbt Cloud tasks and flows.
dbt-cloud-credentials.code_example:
Load stored dbt Cloud credentials:
```python
from prefect_dbt.cloud import DbtCloudCredentials

dbt_cloud_credentials = DbtCloudCredentials.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

Use DbtCloudCredentials instance to trigger a job run:
```python
from prefect_dbt.cloud import DbtCloudCredentials

credentials = DbtCloudCredentials(api_key="my_api_key", account_id=123456789)

async with dbt_cloud_credentials.get_administrative_client() as client:
    client.trigger_job_run(job_id=1)
```

Load saved dbt Cloud credentials within a flow:
```python
from prefect import flow

from prefect_dbt.cloud import DbtCloudCredentials
from prefect_dbt.cloud.jobs import trigger_dbt_cloud_job_run


@flow
def trigger_dbt_cloud_job_run_flow():
    credentials = DbtCloudCredentials.load("my-dbt-credentials")
    trigger_dbt_cloud_job_run(dbt_cloud_credentials=credentials, job_id=1)

trigger_dbt_cloud_job_run_flow()
```

fields.title: DbtCloudCredentials
fields.description: Credentials block for credential use across dbt Cloud tasks and flows.

api_key.title: API Key
api_key.description: A dbt Cloud API key to use for authentication.

account_id.title: Account ID
account_id.description: The ID of your dbt Cloud account.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: The base domain of your dbt Cloud instance.

dbt-core-operation.name: dbt Core Operation
dbt-core-operation.description:
A block representing a dbt operation, containing multiple dbt and shell commands.

For long-lasting operations, use the trigger method and utilize the block as a
context manager for automatic closure of processes when context is exited.
If not, manually call the close method to close processes.

For short-lasting operations, use the run method. Context is automatically managed
with this method.
dbt-core-operation.code_example:
Load a configured block.
```python
from prefect_dbt import DbtCoreOperation

dbt_op = DbtCoreOperation.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

Execute short-lasting dbt debug and list with a custom DbtCliProfile.
```python
from prefect_dbt import DbtCoreOperation, DbtCliProfile
from prefect_dbt.cli.configs import SnowflakeTargetConfigs
from prefect_snowflake import SnowflakeConnector

snowflake_connector = await SnowflakeConnector.load("snowflake-connector")
target_configs = SnowflakeTargetConfigs(connector=snowflake_connector)
dbt_cli_profile = DbtCliProfile(
    name="jaffle_shop",
    target="dev",
    target_configs=target_configs,
)
profile = dbt_cli_profile.get_profile()
dbt_init = DbtCoreOperation(
    commands=["dbt debug", "dbt list"],
    dbt_cli_profile=dbt_cli_profile,
    overwrite_profiles=True
)
dbt_init.run()
```

Execute a longer-lasting dbt run as a context manager.
```python
with DbtCoreOperation(commands=["dbt run"]) as dbt_run:
    dbt_process = dbt_run.trigger()
    # do other things
    dbt_process.wait_for_completion()
    dbt_output = dbt_process.fetch_result()
```

fields.title: DbtCoreOperation
fields.description:
A block representing a dbt operation, containing multiple dbt and shell commands.

For long-lasting operations, use the trigger method and utilize the block as a
context manager for automatic closure of processes when context is exited.
If not, manually call the close method to close processes.

For short-lasting operations, use the run method. Context is automatically managed
with this method.

commands.title: Commands
commands.description: A list of commands to execute sequentially.

env.title: Environment Variables
env.description: Environment variables to use for the subprocess.

working_dir.title: Working Directory
working_dir.description: The absolute path to the working directory the command will be executed within.

shell.title: Shell
shell.description: The shell to run the command with; if unset, defaults to `powershell` on Windows and `bash` on other platforms.

extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension to use for the temporary file; if unset, defaults to `.ps1` on Windows and `.sh` on other platforms.

profiles_dir.title: Profiles Dir
profiles_dir.description: The directory to search for the profiles.yml file. Setting this appends the `--profiles-dir` option to the dbt commands provided. If this is not set, will try using the DBT_PROFILES_DIR environment variable, but if that's also not set, will use the default directory `$HOME/.dbt/`.

project_dir.title: Project Dir
project_dir.description: The directory to search for the dbt_project.yml file. Default is the current working directory and its parents.

overwrite_profiles.title: Overwrite Profiles
overwrite_profiles.description: Whether the existing profiles.yml file under profiles_dir should be overwritten with a new profile.

dbt_cli_profile.title: Dbt Cli Profile
dbt_cli_profile.description: Profiles class containing the profile written to profiles.yml. Note! This is optional and will raise an error if profiles.yml already exists under profile_dir and overwrite_profiles is set to False.
